Roll an attack dice. If you roll a :atSmash: or :atCrit: take one of your opponent's unspent glory points.
**Reaction:** Play this card during an Attack action or ploy that will take a friendly fighter out of action. Choose an enemy fighter adjacent to the target. They suffer 1 damage.
When resolving the first Attack action in the next activation, you and your opponent roll off. The winner chooses whether the Attack action fails or succeeds.
Choose an enemy fighter and push them one hex.
One fighter supporting the first Attack action in the next activation is considered to be two supporting fighters.
**Reaction:** Play this when an opponent plays a ploy. Draw two power cards.
Push all fighters one hex. You must push them all in the same direction. Any that cannot be pushed this way are not pushed.
The first friendly fighter to be targeted by an Attack action in the next activation has +1 Defence.
Roll eight dice. Choose a friendly fighter and push them up to a number of hexes equal to the number of :atCrit: rolled.
**Reaction:** Play this when an opponent plays a ploy. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfBlock: or :dfCrit: that ploy has no effect.
Friendly fighters holding objectives have +1 Defence for the next activation.
Choose an enemy fighter and roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfBlock: or :dfCrit: that fighter cannot make any actions or be damaged in this phase.
You can re-roll any attack dice for the first friendly fighter's Attack action in the next activation.
**Reaction:** Play this after an adjacent enemy fighter makes an Attack action that drives a friendly fighter back. Push the attacker into the hex the friendly fighter was driven back from.

Choose a hex on the battlefield, then push all fighters one hex (in whichever order you choose). This push must move them away from the chosen hex. If there is no hex you could push a fighter into, do not push them.
Choose a friendly fighter and roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfBlock: or :dfCrit: remove up to two wound tokens from them. Otherwise remove one wound token from them.
Choose a friendly fighter that hasn't made a Move action this phase and is on any edge hex. Place them on any other edge hex. They are considered to have made a Move action.
Choose one of your fighters on the battlefield. Place them on a starting hex in your territory.
Discard all power cards in your hand and draw three power cards.
Choose a friendly fighter. They become Inspired.
All fighters' Move characteristics are reduced to 1 for the next activation.

**Reaction:** Play this during an Attack action that would take a friendly fighter out of action. Roll a defence dice. If the result would not normally be a success for this fighter, ignore the damage from that Attack action on this fighter.
**Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action or ploy that takes a friendly fighter out of action. Choose one of their universal upgrades and give it to an adjacent friendly fighter.
If the first Attack action in the next activation is a critical hit, double its Damage characteristic for that Attack action.
Your first Attack action with a Range characteristic of 1 in the next activation targets all adjacent enemy fighters. Roll for each.
Taking it in turns with your opponent(s), starting with you and going clockwise, move each objective one hex. Objectives cannot be moved into a hex that already contains an objective.
**Reaction:** Play this when a friendly fighter is chosen by a ploy. Choose another friendly fighter that could be chosen by that ploy. That fighter is chosen instead.

Choose an enemy fighter and roll an attack dice. If you roll a :atSmash: or :atCrit: make an Attack action with them as if they were a friendly fighter. Fighters do not provide support for this Attack action (in attack or defence).

The first time one of your fighters is targeted in the next activation, roll an extra defence dice. When counting your successes, ignore one of the defence dice.
**Reaction:** Play this after an enemy fighter's Move action. Make a Move action with a friendly fighter who has not already made a Move action in this phase.
**Reaction:** Play this after you upgrade a fighter in an action phase. They can make a Move or Attack action.

**Reaction:** Play this during an enemy Attack action that would succeed. Roll a defence dice. On a roll of :dfDodge: or :dfCrit: the attacker suffers the damage, rather than the target, and neither fighter is driven back.
Choose a friendly fighter with at least one wound token, and an adjacent enemy fighter. The enemy fighter suffers 1 damage.

Choose a friendly fighter. If they are taken out of action in the next activation, you gain a glory point.
**Reaction:** Play this after a friendly fighter's Attack action that takes an adjacent enemy fighter with an upgrade out of action. Gain an additional glory point.

Score this in an end phase if an opponent's warband attempted to cast at least one spell and did not successfully cast any spells in the preceding phase.
Score this immediately if the first fighter taken out of action in this round is a friendly fighter.
Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy fighter out of action with an Attack action that deals an amount of damage that is at least twice the target's Wounds characteristic.
Score this immediately if you use your warband's third action or card that Scatters in the same phase.
Score this immediately if an enemy fighter is taken out of action by a lethal hex.
Score this in an end phase if you and an opponent are tied for the same number of glory points (at least 1).
Score this in the third end phase if there are at least three surviving friendly fighters, and none of them are Inspired.
Score this in an end phase if your opponent scored no objectives in the preceding action phase.
Score this immediately if each hex adjacent to an enemy fighter is either occupied, blocked or lethal.
Score this in an end phase if you scored at least four other objective cards in this round.
Score this immediately if you roll three or more dice in an attack or defence roll and they all show the same symbol.
Score this in an end phase if you scored at least one objective card in the preceding action phase.
Score this immediately if all of the successes (at least two) in your attack or defence roll were support symbols.
Score this in the third end phase if you took the second activation in each round.
Score this immediately if there are two or more :atCrit: in your attack roll.
Score this in an end phase if you removed at least one wound token from each of at least two surviving friendly fighters in the preceding action phase.
Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) have at least one Katophrane Tome.
Score this in an end phase if you have more glory points than an opponent.
Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) made a Move action in the preceding action phase.
Score this immediately if your warband removes an objective from the battlefield.
Score this immediately if you have three or more :atCrit: when rolling to determine who takes the first activation in a round and win that roll.
Score this in an end phase if a surviving friendly fighter has three or more upgrades.
Score this in an end phase if you gained at least 3 glory points in this round.
Score this immediately if a friendly fighter takes an enemy wizard out of action with a spell.
Score this immediately if your warband successfully casts a spell as a reaction.
Score this immediately if your warband takes an enemy fighter out of action with a spell.
Score this immediately if all surviving friendly fighters (at least three) have one or more Guard tokens.
Score this immediately if the first fighter taken out of action in this round is an enemy fighter.
Score this in an end phase if you hold three or more objectives.
*(Errata update)* Score this in an end phase if your warband took an enemy leader out of action in the preceding action phase, and that leader was the first fighter taken out of action in this game.
Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 1 and 4.
Score this in an end phase if you hold objectives 2 and 5.
Score this immediately if your warband takes an enemy fighter with at least two upgrades out of action.
Score this in an end phase if three or more enemy fighters are out of action.
Score this in an end phase if a single friendly fighter took three or more enemy fighters out of action in the preceding action phase.
Score this in the third end phase if there are no surviving enemy fighters and no friendly fighters out of action.
Score this immediately if an opponent discards three objective cards in an end phase.
Score this in an end phase if all surviving friendly fighters (at least two) are in a single group with each fighter adjacent to at least one other friendly fighter.
Score this in an end phase if the same friendly fighter made both an Attack action with a Range of 1 or 2 and an Attack action with a Range of 3 or more in the preceding action phase.
Score this immediately if a friendly fighter's Attack action with Cleave succeeds.
Score this immediately if your leader takes an enemy wizard out of action.
Score this in the third end phase if there are at least three surviving friendly fighters, and no surviving friendly fighter has an upgrade.
**Gambit Spell (:MagChannel:):** If this spell is cast, choose an objective token within four hexes of the caster. Remove it from the battlefield.

**Gambit Spell (:MagChannel:):** If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of the caster. That fighter has -1 Wounds (to a minimum of 1). This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.
Until the next power step, spells that would require :MagChannel: instead require :MagFocus: and vice versa.

**Reaction:** Play this during an Attack action that targets a friendly fighter, before the attack roll. You cannot make a defence roll, but the target of the Attack action cannot be driven back. After the Attack action, if the friendly fighter survives, immediately make an attack action with that fighter that targets their attacker.

**Reaction :MagCrit::** Cast this spell after an enemy fighter casts a spell. If this spell is cast, that fighter suffers 1 damage and they can no longer cast spells. This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.
**Gambit Spell (:MagCrit:):** If this spell is cast choose one gambit spell from your power discard pile and add it to your hand.
**Gambit Spell (:MagFocus::MagFocus:):** If this spell is cast, reduce all damage suffered by the caster by 1, to a minimum of 1. This spell persists until the caster is out of action.
**Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If this spell is cast, choose one persisting spell. That spell is discarded.
**Gambit Spell (:MagChannel:):** If this spell is cast, switch the positions of two adjacent fighters.

The first time a fighter would make a Move action in the next activation, their player instead Scatters X from the hex that fighter occupies, and pushes the fighter along the chain to the end hex. X is the fighter's Move characteristic. If the fighter cannot be pushed into a hex, the push ends in the last hex in the chain they can occupy. Place a Move token next to that fighter.

Choose a hex (other than a blocked hex) within three hexes of a friendly fighter, and Scatter 1 from that hex. Then roll an attack dice. On a roll of :atSmash: or :atCrit:, any fighter in or adjacent to the end hex suffers 1 damage.
**Gambit Spell (:MagChannel:):** If this spell is cast, Scatter 1 from any hex on the battlefield. Any fighter in the end hex is Inspired.
*(Errata update)* Choose a fighter and push all other fighters that are within 2 hexes 1 hex so that they are closer to that fighter in an order you choose.
Push your leader up to three hexes. They must end this push on a starting hex.
**Reaction:** Play this when an enemy fighter successfully casts a spell with Scatter, before they resolve the Scatter. You resolve the Scatter instead. The effect of the spell remains the same.
Choose two fighters that are adjacent to each other and switch them.

**Reaction:** Play this after an enemy fighter's Move action that is part of a Charge action. Choose a friendly fighter and push them up to three hexes. They must end this push adjacent to the enemy fighter.
Choose a friendly wizard. They suffer 1 damage. The first time they attempt to cast a spell before the next power step, any fighter damaged by that spell suffers 1 additional damage.
**Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action that targets a friendly fighter and fails. You can push the target up to two hexes.

**Reaction:** Play this during an enemy warband's gambit or enemy fighter's Attack action that takes a friendly fighter out of action. For each fighter adjacent to that fighter, roll an attack dice. On a roll of :atSmash: the fighter being rolled for suffers 1 damage.
Choose a friendly fighter. Enemy fighters adjacent to that fighter can't be pushed until the next power step.
+1 Dice for the first Attack action in the next activation.
**Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action that targets a friendly fighter and fails. Remove up to one wound token from that fighter's fighter card.

**Gambit Spell (:MagChannel:):** If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter adjacent to the caster. Take up to 2 wound tokens from that fighter's fighter card and put them on the caster's fighter card.
Choose an enemy fighter in an edge hex. They suffer 1 damage.

**Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If this spell is cast, choose an enemy fighter within four hexes of the caster. That fighter suffers 1 damage at the beginning of each round, before the first activation. This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.
The first fighter to be the target of an Attack action in the next activation has a Defence characteristic (before other modifiers) of :dfDodge: 2, instead of their usual characteristic.
Choose a fighter. The first fighter to make an Attack action while adjacent to that fighter in the next activation has -1 Dice to a minimum of 1.
Discard an objective card and draw an objective card.
Choose a friendly fighter and an upgrade card from your hand that you can apply to that fighter. That fighter suffers 1 damage. If they survive, apply the upgrade to that fighter.
**Reaction:** Play this after an Attack action with a Range of 1 that targets a friendly fighter and fails, if there are any :atCrit: in your defence roll. The attacker suffers 2 damage.

**Gambit Spell (:MagChannel:):** If this spell is cast, choose an empty hex adjacent to the caster and place the chasm token on it. A hex with a chasm token is a lethal hex. Remove the token at the end of the action phase.

**Gambit Spell (:MagFocus:):** If this spell is cast, choose a friendly fighter within four hexes of the caster. Remove up to one wound token from that fighter's fighter card at the beginning of each round, before the first activation. This spell persists until that fighter is out of action.

**Domain** \n If one or more **Domain** gambits have been played in this round, this fighter cannot be chosen after a gambit card has been played and cannot be **dealt** damage by gambits until the end of this round.
+1 Dice to this fighter's Range 1 **Attack actions**. \n +2 Dice to this fighter's Range 1 **Attack actions** instead if this fighter is a **beast**.
**Innate** (:atSup1:) to this fighter's Range 1 **Attack actions**. If this fighter is a **companion**, +1 Damage to this fighter's Range 1 **Attack actions**.
+1 Defence if this fighter is in a **cover** hex. This fighter cannot be on Guard.
-1 Wounds, to a minimum of 1. **Innate** (:dfDodge:) while this fighter is in a **cover** hex. \n This fighter cannot be on Guard.

**Bound Spell** \n You cannot give this card to a **Khorne** fighter. \n **Spell Action (:MagFocus:):** If **cast**, pick one feature token that is not an objective token and is within 3 hexes of the caster. **Place** that feature token in the same hex as the caster. This fighter is a **wizard** (1) while attempting  to **cast** this **spell**, and cannot attempt to **cast** any other **spells**. After this fighter makes this action, **break** this card.
**Attack action** \n [:Hex: 2 - :atSmash: 3 - :boom: 2 -(Cleave)-] \n This fighter cannot make this **Attack action** unless this fighter is in a **cover** hex.
This fighter is an **assassin**. \n **Reaction:** After a **scatter** ability is resolved, **push** this fighter up to 2 hexes.
**Denizen** \n **Attack actions** made by this fighter that target a fighter in a **cover** hex have **Grievous** and **Ensnare**.
